episodes.summary: South Park residents join the rest of the country in celebrating the election of a U.S. president, who moves a new administration into the White House ahead of schedule.

episodes.name: Elementary School Musical
episodes.summary: The boys are startled to learn that their popularity at school is waning when they fail to submit to the latest fad, which actually makes Butters cooler than they are.

episodes.name: The Ungroundable
episodes.summary: In the 12th-season finale, vampire sightings at school anger the Goth kids, who are upset when they become indistinguishable from the bloodsucking interlopers in the eyes of their peers.

episodes.name: The Ring
episodes.summary: In the 13th-season premiere, Kenny gets less than he bargained for when he takes his new girlfriend to a Jonas Brothers concert.

episodes.name: The Coon
episodes.summary: Rival vigilantes battle for supremacy as crime-fighting icons of the town.

episodes.name: Margaritaville
episodes.summary: Randy's solution to fix the economy finds enthusiastic support in the community and revolutionizes the way people live their lives.

episodes.name: Eat, Pray, Queef
episodes.summary: An April Fools' joke goes bad, inspiring fear and fury among the boys.

episodes.name: Fishsticks
episodes.summary: Cartman helps Jimmy with a comedy routine that becomes the sensation of the year until it's time to take credit for the joke.

episodes.name: Pinewood Derby
episodes.summary: Randy pulls out all the stops to make sure that Stan wins first place in the annual Pinewood Derby

episodes.name: Fatbeard
episodes.summary: Buoyed by news of pirates in Somalia, Cartman hatches a plan to run away to live the life of a buccaneer.

episodes.name: Dead Celebrities
episodes.summary: Kyle seeks help from paranormal experts when his little brother is haunted by ghosts.

episodes.name: Butters' Bottom Bitch
episodes.summary: Butters hopes his first kiss will put an end to his friends' ridicule.

episodes.name: W.T.F.
episodes.summary: The boys aspire to be professional wrestlers after seeing their first match live

episodes.name: Whale Whores
episodes.summary: Stan vows to save the dolphins after a family visit to an aquarium in Denver on his birthday is marred by a mass slaughter of aquatic mammals.

episodes.name: The F Word
episodes.summary: The boys take action when a motorcycle festival takes over the town.

episodes.name: Dances with Smurfs
episodes.summary: Cartman is selected to read the morning announcements at school, but he turns the forum into a bully pulpit to unleash criticism of the student-body president.

episodes.name: Pee
episodes.summary: In the 13th-season finale, the boys' trip to a local water park comes with apocalyptic overtones.

episodes.name: Sexual Healing
episodes.summary: In the 14th-season premiere, scientific testing reveals that some of the fourth-grade boys are sex addicts.

episodes.name: The Tale of Scrotie McBoogerballs
episodes.summary: After being assigned to read a book that was once banned, the boys are inspired to collaborate on one of their own.

episodes.name: Medicinal Fried Chicken
episodes.summary: When a store selling medical marijuana opens on the site of Cartman's favorite fried-chicken joint, Randy is first in line to buy some weed. But he can't because he's completely healthy. Meanwhile, Cartman will stop at nothing to get the restaurant back.

episodes.name: You Have 0 Friends
episodes.summary: Kyle turns to Stan for help with a Facebook crisis.
South Park is the target of a class-action lawsuit on behalf of all the vengeful celebrities who have been mocked by the town.
The identity of Cartman's dad is on everyone's mind despite threats from the ginger kids about Muhammad and enraged celebrities who have harnessed the power of Mecha Streisand.

episodes.name: Crippled Summer
episodes.summary: Jimmy and Timmy go to summer camp with a winner-take-all attitude in a variety of contests, including Jimmy's participation in a surfing competition. Towelie faces an intervention for his addictions.

episodes.name: Poor and Stupid
episodes.summary: Cartman's dream to become a NASCAR driver comes true, with Butters as his pit boss.

episodes.name: It's a Jersey Thing
episodes.summary: Randy spearheads the town's defense when "Jersey Shore"-inspired Garden State residents are threatening to take over the entire country.

episodes.name: Insheeption
episodes.summary: Stan talks to Mr. Mackey about his hoarding disorder, but learns the guidance counselor has problems with the same compulsion.

episodes.name: Coon 2: Hindsight
episodes.summary: The Coon leads a group of crimefighters who spring into action to help victims of another drilling catastrophe in the Gulf.

episodes.name: Mysterion Rises
episodes.summary: The identity of Mysterion is revealed when the Coon, abandoned by his crime-fighting cohorts, seeks revenge in the Gulf.

episodes.name: Coon vs. Coon & Friends
episodes.summary: Cthulhu does Cartman's bidding, leaving Coon & Friends at his mercy; Kenny's curse presents a dilemma.

episodes.name: Crème Fraiche
episodes.summary: In the 14th-season finale, Randy's addiction to the Food Network has a detrimental effect on his family.

episodes.name: HUMANCENTiPAD
episodes.summary: The 15th season begins with the launch of a revolutionary tablet computer, though Cartman is feeling left out of the technology craze.

episodes.name: Funnybot
episodes.summary: Jimmy hosts the Special Ed department's inaugural Comedy Awards, but a comment about the Germans' sense of humor gets the school in hot water.

episodes.name: Royal Pudding
episodes.summary: Canadian-born Ike shares his country's obsession with a royal wedding and offers his services when the princess-to-be is abducted.

episodes.name: T.M.I.
episodes.summary: Cartman is sent to anger-management therapy when he's upset after personal information about the boys is posted on the school bulletin board.

episodes.name: Crack Baby Athletic Association
episodes.summary: Cartman hatches a plan to help babies who are born addicted to drugs

episodes.name: City Sushi
episodes.summary: Butters gets diagnosed with multiple personality disorder, and he's prescribed medication.

episodes.name: You're Getting Old
episodes.summary: Stan's outlook on life begins to change after his 10th birthday, but it also affects his friendships with the other kids, who find they have little in common with him anymore.

episodes.name: Ass Burgers
episodes.summary: Stan's stuck in an abnormal rut; Cartman suspects he has Asperger's syndrome.

episodes.name: The Last of the Meheecans
episodes.summary: Cartman fancies himself an agent of the U.S. Border Patrol when the boys play Texans vs. Mexicans.

episodes.name: Bass to Mouth
episodes.summary: A hacker wreaks havoc with gossipy Web posts on a site called "The South Park Elementary Eavesdropper."

episodes.name: Broadway Bro Down
episodes.summary: Randy turns into a huge fan of Broadway shows after he takes Sharon to see a hit musical in Denver.
Cartman's lack of physical fitness makes him a target for the other kids' scorn.

episodes.name: A History Channel Thanksgiving
episodes.summary: The boys learn what really happened at the first Thanksgiving—including an extraterrestrial presence—from a TV documentary.

episodes.name: The Poor Kid
episodes.summary: In the 15th-season finale, the arrest of Kenny's parents sends him and his two siblings into the foster-care system, but the situation creates a dilemma for Cartman, who is left without a target to mock for being the poorest kid in school.

episodes.name: Reverse Cowgirl
episodes.summary: Tragedy strikes when one of the boys repeatedly ignores reminders about leaving the toilet seat up in the Season 16 premiere.

episodes.name: Cash for Gold
episodes.summary: Cartman targets a specific—and vulnerable—clientele when he starts his own shopping channel for gems, while Stan researches the value of a piece of jewelry that was a gift from his grandfather.

episodes.name: Faith Hilling
episodes.summary: An evolutionary development poses a grave threat to humanity.

episodes.name: Jewpacabra
episodes.summary: The town's Easter-egg hunt may be canceled due to rumors of a vicious beast that Cartman claims to have caught on film.

episodes.name: Butterballs
episodes.summary: Stan organizes an antibullying video when Butters is tormented by an unlikely predator.

episodes.name: I Should Have Never Gone Ziplining
episodes.summary: The boys try zip-lining in the Colorado mountains on the last day of spring break, but their adventure takes a dangerous, life-threatening turn.

episodes.name: Cartman Finds Love
episodes.summary: A romance for Cartman may finally become a reality when there's a new girl at school.

episodes.name: Sarcastaball
episodes.summary: Randy's campaign to prevent head injuries in football radically changes the way the game is played, but the new rules become a national sensation and even make a South Park student a star athlete.

episodes.name: Raising the Bar
episodes.summary: Cartman finally comes to the realization that he's overweight, but declares that the solution is to ride around on a mobility scooter. Also: Cartman learns he has a rival in a young reality-TV star.

episodes.name: Insecurity
episodes.summary: Kyle suspects that his mother is having an affair with a deliveryman; Cartman installs a home-security system.

episodes.name: Going Native
episodes.summary: When Butters starts acting out at school, his parents realize it's time to tell him why he's not like all of the other kids. He must travel to a foreign place to learn the ways of his people. It will be a difficult trip for a young boy to make alone, so Butters chooses Kenny to travel with him to the distant and secluded island of Hawaii.

episodes.name: A Nightmare on Face Time
episodes.summary: The boys' plans to go trick-or-treating as their comic-book heroes, the Avengers, hit a snag when Stan's dad needs his son's help with a new business venture.

episodes.name: A Scause for Applause
episodes.summary: An icon is implicated in a doping scandal, so supporters start cutting off their symbolic wristbands.

episodes.name: Obama Wins!
episodes.summary: In the series 16 finale, Cartman believes he can affect the outcome of the 2012 presidential election.

episodes.name: Let Go, Let Gov
episodes.summary: In the Season 17 premiere, Cartman infiltrates the National Security Agency and is upset by what he finds in his personal file. Meanwhile, Butters finds a new audience for his prayers.

episodes.name: Informative Murder Porn
episodes.summary: The boys try to keep their parents from hurting one another by using a distraction in the form of the game "Minecraft."

episodes.name: World War Zimmerman
episodes.summary: Token is deemed a threat to all humanity by Cartman.

episodes.name: Goth Kids 3: Dawn of the Posers
episodes.summary: A goth kid is sent to a camp for troubled youth, but upon her return her friends find her changed in disturbing ways, so they turn to an unlikely group for help.

episodes.name: Taming Strange
episodes.summary: Ike just isn't himself lately and he and Kyle are growing apart. Kyle goes to the guidance counselor for advice, but Mr. Mackey is too busy dealing with the bugs in the school's new integrated technology system to help. Kyle decides to take Ike to a live performance of his favorite show, "Yo Gabba Gabba!" He hopes it'll make his little brother like him again.

episodes.name: Ginger Cow
episodes.summary: Cartman facilitates world peace with his latest prank, which brings religious leaders to South Park to witness the fulfillment of a Biblical prophecy.

episodes.name: The Black Friday Trilogy
episodes.summary: It's the biggest Black Friday sale in history. The boys are divided over which gaming device to buy and a bloody battle will determine whether Xbox or Sony will be the winner.

episodes.name: A Song of Ass and Fire
episodes.summary: Console wars escalate as throngs of shoppers push toward the mall in anticipation of Black Friday. Meanwhile, Cartman seeks revenge against Princess Kenny.

episodes.name: Titties and Dragons
episodes.summary: The war over gaming devices begins as the malls open for the holiday-shopping craze.

episodes.name: The Hobbit
episodes.summary: Wendy plays matchmaker by trying to pair one of her gal pals with Butters, only to end up in the counselor's office.

episodes.name: Go Fund Yourself
episodes.summary: The group attempt to make a kickstarter company to raise money instead of going to school. The episode focuses on kickstarter and how people can make money before producing a product.

episodes.name: Gluten Free Ebola
episodes.summary: After the group attempted a kickstarter company in a previous episode they are hated by everyone else at school so attempt to throw a party whilst the town is thrown into chaos over the threat of gluten.

episodes.name: The Cissy
episodes.summary: Stan is searching for answers about how a person who he's always known to be one thing could suddenly identify with another. In the meantime, the pressure of holding on to a giant secret is starting to get to Randy.

episodes.name: Handicar
episodes.summary: Handicapped driven vehicles compete with taxi's and other vehicles. The company entitled "Handicar" with the lead driver being Timmy.

episodes.name: The Magic Bush
episodes.summary: A scandalous invasion of privacy makes the South Park denizens edgy as Cartman and Butters get in possession of a drone.

episodes.name: Freemium Isn't Free
episodes.summary: Stan's addicted to a new app marketed by Terrance and Phillip, but the duo find that all the money they're making can't buy happiness.

episodes.name: Grounded Vindaloop
episodes.summary: Butters is convinced that he's living in a virtual reality. When he suddenly goes rogue and wreaks havoc at home and all over South Park, everyone struggles to figure out what's real.

episodes.name: Cock Magic
episodes.summary: Kenny excels at playing the game, Magic: The Gathering. He has the boys' full attention until a new, hard-core activity gets in the way. When Wendy tries to get Stan to pay attention to what she's doing, she realizes that what he does with his guy friends always comes first.

episodes.name: #rehash
episodes.summary: Randy's forced to perform again after Stan spends all the Marsh's money on freemium games; Kyle gets upset when Ike doesn't want to play with him anymore.

episodes.name: #HappyHolograms
episodes.summary: Kyle plans a holiday special for TV in hopes of bringing families together again with help from some of the biggest names in entertainment. Meanwhile, Cartmaaan Bra is still trending as holograms continue to run rampant in South Park.

episodes.name: Stunning and Brave
episodes.summary: There is a new principal at the helm of South Park Elementary. He forces the boys to confront the damage they've done through their history of racism and unconscious bias.

episodes.name: Where My Country Gone?
episodes.summary: Tired of illegal immigrants continuously crossing over the border into the United States without any repercussions, Mr. Garrison wants a wall to be built to keep them out of the country.

episodes.name: The City Part of Town
episodes.summary: Kenny tries to land a job when the town of South Park begins gentrifying.

episodes.name: You're Not Yelping
episodes.summary: Cartman considers himself the top on-line restaurant reviewer in South Park.

episodes.name: Safe Space
episodes.summary: Cartman is the latest victim of Body Shaming.

episodes.name: Tweek x Craig
episodes.summary: The news of a romantic relationship between Tweek and Craig hits South Park Elementary.

episodes.name: Naughty Ninjas
episodes.summary: A game of Ninja Warriors is led by Kenny and attracts attention from foreign terrorists. Meanwhile, the citizens of South Park decide they don't need a police department anymore.

episodes.name: Sponsored Content
episodes.summary: Jimmy challenges PC Principal when the budding newsman is flagged for inappropriate language in the school paper.

episodes.name: Truth and Advertising
episodes.summary: PC Principal disappears along with 2 fourth grade students. The latest news in the school paper sets the boys on a search to find their two missing classmates. Being the crack reporter that he is, Jimmy sets out to learn everything he can about what makes Leslie tick. Meanwhile, Principal Victoria and Mr. Garrison return to a South Park that has become unrecognizable

episodes.name: PC Principal Final Justice
episodes.summary: Kyle has chosen a dangerous alliance over his friendship with Stan.

episodes.name: Member Berries
episodes.summary: An American icon gives the National Anthem a reboot.

episodes.name: Skank Hunt
episodes.summary: An online troll threatens to have global implications as Cartman professes his innocence.

episodes.name: The Damned
episodes.summary: Gerald basks in the thrill of media attention as he continues to troll everyone.

episodes.name: Wieners Out
episodes.summary: Kyle feels guilty for the tension between the boys and the girls, but Butters brings his gender together to stand up for their rights. Meanwhile, Gerald is worried that his cover may be blown.

episodes.name: Douche and a Danish
episodes.summary: Garrison finally goes too far at a rally and reconsiders his future in politics. Meanwhile, the kids begin searching for an infamous Internet troll; and Gerald joins the opposition to a Danish campaign tracking nefarious characters on the Web.

episodes.name: Fort Collins
episodes.summary: An entire city in Colorado gets hacked. Gerald and Cartman may lose everything when their complete history of internet activity becomes public.

episodes.name: Oh Jeez
episodes.summary: PC Principal plays peacemaker between the girls and the boys one more time. Meanwhile, the election results are in, and Gerald is confronted by the Troll Hunter.

episodes.name: Members Only
episodes.summary: The new President-elect visits his hometown.

episodes.name: Not Funny
episodes.summary: Cartman becomes convinced that Butters wants to steal his girlfriend.

episodes.name: The End of Serialization as We Know It
episodes.summary: Cartman finally understands why Heidi wants him to get to Mars.

episodes.name: White People Renovating Houses
episodes.summary: Protestors armed with tiki torches and confederate flags take to the streets of South Park; Randy comes to grips with what it means to be white in today's society.

episodes.name: Put It Down
episodes.summary: North Korea takes aim at South Park. While Craig and Tweek have problems trying to find a place to hide.

episodes.name: Holiday Special
episodes.summary: Everyone is going crazy as Columbus Day gets canceled and the kids try to bring it back as they would have a free day.

episodes.name: Franchise Prequel
episodes.summary: Facebook is the ultimate weapon for Professor Chaos.

episodes.name: Hummels & Heroin
episodes.summary: Beloved entertainers are being cut down in their prime due to massive overdoses of opiates. Stan is about to be exposed as the source of the illegal drugs.

episodes.name: Sons a Witches
episodes.summary: This year at the traditional Halloween get together, a witch casts a spell that terrorizes the town and ruins Halloween for the boys. Cartman sees a way to use the witch's power to his advantage.

episodes.name: Doubling Down
episodes.summary: Kyle is playing with fire when he gets in the middle of Cartman and Heidi's relationship.

episodes.name: Moss Piglets
episodes.summary: Timmy and Jimmy's science project has caught the attention of some very important people who think it can save the world.

episodes.name: Super Hard PCness
episodes.summary:
It's never been more challenging to be a PC Principal.

Witness the return of Terrance and Philip via the power of Netflix! Kyle isn't impressed. Meanwhile, PC Principal falls in love with the new Vice-Principal...

episodes.name: Splatty Tomato
episodes.summary: The children of South Park claim to have seen Mr. Garrison lurking around town, and the townspeople are angry that the president is scaring their kids.

episodes.name: Dead Kids
episodes.summary: With several shooting occurring at South Park Elementary School, Randy attempts to get Sharon to get her emotions in check. Meanwhile, Cartman is mad after realizing he flunked his math quiz, despite copying his answers off Token's quiz.

episodes.name: A Boy and a Priest
episodes.summary: A very special relationship has developed between Butters and the Parish Priest. When the town finds the church doors locked and no sign of the pair, they call in the Catholic Church.

episodes.name: The Problem with a Poo
episodes.summary: Mr. Hankey's offensive behavior puts him in jeopardy of being fired as the Director of the Annual Christmas Pageant.

episodes.name: Tegridy Farms
episodes.summary: The Vaping epidemic hits South Park Elementary

movies.name: Silicon Valley
movies.summary: In the high-tech gold rush of modern Silicon Valley, the people most qualified to succeed are the least capable of handling success. From Mike Judge comes this satire about a programmer whose game-changing algorithm becomes the subject of a valley-wide bidding war.

episodes.name: Minimum Viable Product
episodes.summary: Attending an elaborate launch party, Richard and his computer programmer friends - Big Head, Dinesh and Gilfoyle - dream of making it big. Instead, they're living in the communal Hacker Hostel owned by former programmer Erlich, who gets to claim ten percent of anything they invent there. When it becomes clear that Richard has developed a powerful compression algorithm for his website, Pied Piper, he finds himself courted by Gavin Belson, his egomaniacal corporate boss, who offers a $10 million buyout by his firm, Hooli. But Richard holds back when well-known investor Peter Gregory makes a counteroffer.

episodes.name: The Cap Table
episodes.summary: After a celebratory party at the Hacker Hostel, Richard and Erlich learn that Peter Gregory won't pay up until they deliver a viable business plan that includes a slimmed-downed staff. A desperate Richard hires former Belson underling Jared, and they set about trying to trim the fat. While Gilfoyle and Dinesh prove essential, Big Head's place in the company is less certain.

episodes.name: Articles of Incorporation
episodes.summary: While Gavin Belson begins to hype Nucleus, a competing compression platform, Richard learns that the name Pied Piper is already registered to a sprinkler company, forcing him to negotiate. Meanwhile, Erlich goes on a vision quest for a new company name, and Peter Gregory proves elusive when one of his companies asks for money.

episodes.name: Fiduciary Duties
episodes.summary: At Peter's toga party, Richard drunkenly promises to make Erlich a board member, which he regrets the next morning. After being unassigned at Hooli, Big Head finds others like him who have made careers out of doing nothing. Richard struggles to put Pied Piper's vision into words for a presentation without Erlich; later, he discovers an interesting connection between Peter and Gavin Belson.

episodes.name: Signaling Risk
episodes.summary: Erlich convinces a graffiti artist to create Pied Piper's logo, with controversial results. Jared tries to make the company more efficient. After Gavin Belson and Peter Gregory unexpectedly come face-to-face, Richard learns that he only has eight weeks to prepare for a live demo at TechCrunch Disrupt.

episodes.name: Third Party Insourcing
episodes.summary: Richard feels threatened when the team hires "The Carver", a hacker with a notorious reputation, to help with Pied Piper's cloud. Jared finds himself taken for a ride when he seeks out Peter Gregory's signature. Erlich and Dinesh compete for the attention of Tara, Gilfoyle's visiting girlfriend. Later, Dinesh faces a sexual dilemma.

episodes.name: Proof of Concept
episodes.summary: At TechCrunch Disrupt, Richard feels the pressure to finish his demo, but finds himself distracted by a girl he dated briefly, who's now spreading rumors about him. Jared worries that Monica is taking his place in the company. Dinesh develops a crush on a girl at a neighboring booth. Erlich's scandalous past connection to one of the judges threatens Pied Piper's chances.

episodes.name: Optimal Tip-to-Tip Efficiency
episodes.summary: Poised to compete at TechCrunch Disrupt, the guys of Pied Piper become worried after an impressive presentation by Gavin Belson. As Jared tries to pivot the company, Richard is inspired to make big changes at the last minute.

episodes.name: Sand Hill Shuffle
episodes.summary: Season 2 begins with the Pied Piper guys being wined and dined by every venture capitalist under the sun, while Monica adjusts to a new managing partner at Raviga as the company faces major changes.

episodes.name: Runaway Devaluation
episodes.summary: Pied Piper could go under if Richard and the guys can't find legal and financial help in the wake of Hooli's bombshell. Meanwhile, Dinesh tries to thwart a fund-raising campaign for his cousin's new app; and Monica tries to keep her interest in Pied Piper separate from her job.

episodes.name: Bad Money
episodes.summary: Richard mulls a proposal by Gavin, but also considers a pitch from Russ Hanneman about backing Pied Piper. Meanwhile, Monica learns surprising news about Richard's deal with Hooli; and Gilfoyle and Dinesh go to extremes to get what they want.

episodes.name: The Lady
episodes.summary: Richard butts heads with Erlich over a prospective hire, while Dinesh and Gilfoyle become suspicious that a new employee they recommended is commanding a higher salary. Big Head gets a surprising promotion at Hooli. At a board meeting, Monica and Richard find themselves outvoted; Jared institutes a workplace harassment policy.

episodes.name: Server Space
episodes.summary: Gavin creates interference that hinders Pied Piper's expansion. Meanwhile, the guys could be threatened by a nosy neighbor; Guilfoyle sets out to build servers; Richard's reluctant to let Jared move in; and Big Head's leadership skills are suspect.

episodes.name: Homicide
episodes.summary: Erlich runs into an old protégé who's now an energy drink billionaire when Monica urges the guys to pursue a livestream opportunity, but Richard learns their friendship isn't what Erlich thinks it is. Meanwhile, Jared wants Carla and Monica to be friends.

episodes.name: Adult Content
episodes.summary: The team fields job offers and Russ is distracted by financial news, but Richard realizes Pied Piper could fold if it doesn't merge with a hated rival. Meanwhile, Dinesh tries to woo a woman online; and Gavin looks on the bright side of Nucleus' failure.

episodes.name: White Hat/Black Hat
episodes.summary: Richard gets paranoid about security after he takes pity on a competitor and inadvertently starts a feud. Meanwhile, Jared fibs about Pied Piper's size; and Gavin looks for a scapegoat when he feels pressure from board members.

episodes.name: Binding Arbitration
episodes.summary: Erlich wants to testify when Pied Piper and Hooli enter binding arbitration, but Richard worries that his rival's claims could have merit. Meanwhile, Jared, Dinesh and Gilfoyle debate a philosophical theory; and Big Head gets a boost.

episodes.name: Two Days of the Condor
episodes.summary: As the guys await the verdict on Pied Piper's fate, an unexpected real-life drama draws a spike in traffic to their livestream and leaves them fighting to hold things together - literally. While Erlich considers his future, Richard scrambles to save Pied Piper's.

episodes.name: Founder Friendly
episodes.summary: After being unceremoniously fired, an angry Richard faces a tough decision: accept the diminished role of CTO, or leave Pied Piper for good. Erlich takes a shine to Jack Barker, Laurie's new choice of CEO, while Dinesh and Gilfoyle weigh their options in Richard's absence. At Hooli, Gavin tries to improve his image by admitting failure, and Big Head gets wind of major changes.

episodes.name: Two in the Box
episodes.summary: The new and improved Pied Piper impresses Dinesh and Gilfoyle, but worries Richard; Jared and Erlich both face housing issues; Gavin suggests a controversial move.

episodes.name: Meinertzhagen's Haversack
episodes.summary: Richard searches for a way around Jack; Gilfoyle opens himself up to recruiters; Dinesh draws unwanted attention from a recent purchase.

episodes.name: Maleant Data Systems Solutions
episodes.summary: The Pied Piper guys struggle to phone it in; Erlich faces competition; Monica takes a stand; Gavin makes a decision about Nucleus.

episodes.name: The Empty Chair
episodes.summary: Richard lets his ego get in the way at an interview; Dinesh, Gilfoyle and Jared misplace hardware; Erlich pitches his plans to Big Head.

episodes.name: Bachmanity Insanity
episodes.summary: Richard's new relationship is threatened by neuroses; Big Head and Erlich's launch party has snags; Dinesh falls for a foreign coworker.

episodes.name: To Build a Better Beta
episodes.summary: When the guys decide to release the beta version of Pied Piper, they receive an unexpected response. With a limited number of beta invites each, Dinesh worries about his lack of friends, while Gilfoyle looks to catch him in a lie. Monica worries about how to deliver criticism. Facing financial woes, Erlich considers a big decision, and Gavin challenges the Nucleus team to do the impossible.

episodes.name: Bachman's Earning's Over-ride
episodes.summary: Erlich struggles to come clean to Richard, who is forced to make a choice between their friendship and the company's future. Jared's new Pied Piper apparel makes a splash, and divides Dinesh and Gilfoyle. As Gavin faces major life changes, the guys celebrate a rare victory.

episodes.name: Daily Active Users
episodes.summary: Upon discovering surprising stats, Richard attempts to bridge the gap between Pied Piper and its users, leading Jared to take drastic measures to hold everything together. Gavin learns secrets about the competition and decides to bring in a new face to reclaim his former glory.

episodes.name: The Uptick
episodes.summary: With Pied Piper's future in question, Erlich's publicity success leaves Richard in a moral quandary, just as Dinesh's video-chat app gathers speed. While Laurie prepares to jump ship, Gavin's comeback at Hooli is threatened by his displays of grandeur.

episodes.name: Success Failure
episodes.summary: In the wake of Pied Piper's clickfarm scandal, the guys struggle to find funding for Pied Piper's video-chat app to keep up with their rapidly growing user base. Erlich faces resistance from Big Head's dad, while Gavin balks after Jack steps on his toes at Hooli. Having a hard time adjusting to his company's pivot, Richard gets sage advice from an unexpected source, leading him to a big idea that could change his future.

episodes.name: Terms of Service
episodes.summary: Richard butts heads with Dinesh, whose new position goes to his head. Later, Richard discovers interesting data about PiperChat's users. Erlich makes a play to be involved in Jian-Yang's new app; Jared sets ground rules in his friendship with Richard; Gavin's paranoia over Jack's enthusiasm causes him to make a rash decision.

episodes.name: Intellectual Property
episodes.summary: An overtired Richard pushes himself to the brink of sanity while trying to move ahead with his next big idea. Eyeing a comeback, Erlich pressures an uncooperative Jian-Yang. Monica sets a trap at Raviga to improve her standing with Laurie. Dinesh goes on a date; Big Head enters the world of academia; Gavin faces an unknown future.

episodes.name: Teambuilding Exercise
episodes.summary: When Richard reaches out to an unlikely ally, Jared worries about the company he's keeping. Gilfoyle gets tough on security in the wake of Dinesh's latest dalliance; later, he considers whether to put his pride aside for a job. Concerned about Jian-Yang's commitment to his app, Erlich takes matters into his own hands.

episodes.name: The Blood Boy
episodes.summary: Cracks in Richard's latest partnership become more apparent when he's forced to deal with an unexpected interloper. As things get more serious, Dinesh scrambles to find a way out of his new relationship. After learning of surprising developments afoot at Raviga, Monica has trouble deciding which horse to back.

episodes.name: Customer Service
episodes.summary: On the hunt for financial support, Richard looks outside the tech bubble, and crosses paths with a contentious figure from Pied Piper's past. Erlich reaches out to Monica and Laurie in search of a new endeavor. A launch gone wrong finds Dinesh and Gilfoyle at war as Jared tries to keep the peace.

episodes.name: The Patent Troll
episodes.summary: When Richard decides to stand up to a patent troll, his defiance ends up coming back to haunt him. Gilfoyle goes to desperate measures to battle Jian-Yang's new smart fridge. Jared embraces multiple identities in his quest to reduce costs. Erlich tries to hang with the alpha males.

episodes.name: The Keenan Vortex
episodes.summary: An unexpected increase in data traffic leads Richard to turn to Erlich for help in garnering a deal with Keenan Feldspar, Silicon Valley's latest "it" boy – but when Keenan makes a too-good-to-resist offer, Richard must weigh Pied Piper's future against a potential mutiny. Jack faces setbacks while preparing for Hooli-Con.

episodes.name: Hooli-Con
episodes.summary: The Pied Piper guys try to pull off a stealth plan at Hooli-Con.

episodes.name: Server Error
episodes.summary: Richard finds himself in a web of lies; Jared plans his exit; Jack bets big; Gavin plots a comeback.

episodes.name: Grow Fast or Die Slow
episodes.summary: Now that Pied Piper has ample funding and new offices, the pressure to get things right stymies Richard and forces him to grow the company in a way he hadn't planned. A picky Dinesh and Gilfoyle question their ability to make good decisions. After returning to Hooli, Gavin worries about becoming antiquated.

episodes.name: Reorientation
episodes.summary: Panicked by suddenly leading a much larger team, Richard finds himself managing a number of small conflicts in his efforts to unite his new employees. Dinesh celebrates a new purchase that Gilfoyle looks to spoil. Jian-Yang goes to court. Gavin meets pushback over his signature and what it says about him.

episodes.name: Chief Operating Officer
episodes.summary: Encouraged by Jared to strike up a friendship with Dana, a like-minded CEO, Richard instead finds himself charmed by Dana's COO, who challenges his loyalty to Gilfoyle. Facing limited housing options thanks to his impulse purchase, Dinesh searches for a new roommate.

episodes.name: Tech Evangelist
episodes.summary: Attempting to woo a gaming company to PiperNet, Richard inadvertently angers a prized ally; Dinesh deals with a betrayal; in preparation for a big launch, Gavin leaves his underlings with a cryptic message; Jared gets inside information from Big Head.

episodes.name: Facial Recognition
episodes.summary: Overshadowed by Jared in an on-camera interview, Richard's confidence wavers further when Laurie and Monica force him to work with Eklow, a new artificial-intelligence company. Gilfoyle worries about the prospect of introducing AI into Pied Piper. Dinesh makes Jared self-conscious ahead of a second interview. Gavin questions his future beyond Hooli.

episodes.name: Artificial Emotional Intelligence
episodes.summary: Richard decides to help when Laurie gets in a jam, but his lack of emotional discipline threatens to backfire on Pied Piper. Gavin tries to make a deal with a stubborn partner while abroad. Dinesh relishes a rare win. Jared bonds with a surprising figure.

episodes.name: Initial Coin Offering
episodes.summary: As the Pied Piper guys prepare to close on their Series B funding, Richard receives some unsettling news. Gilfoyle suggests a risky proposition and Monica gets blunt with Richard. Dinesh goes to great lengths to compete with a coworker, while Jared keeps close watch on Richard's new assistant. In search of a better deal, Gavin tries to charm small-town America.

episodes.name: Fifty-One Percent
episodes.summary: The launch of PiperNet finds Monica suspicious of an early success, and the team must race against the clock as their future is threatened. Realizing he's made more enemies then friends, Richard makes a surprising move.

movies.name: Homeland
movies.summary: The winner of 6 Emmy Awards including Outstanding Drama Series, Homeland is an edge-of-your-seat sensation. Marine Sergeant Nicholas Brody is both a decorated hero and a serious threat. CIA officer Carrie Mathison is tops in her field despite being bipolar. The delicate dance these two complex characters perform, built on lies, suspicion, and desire, is at the heart of this gripping, emotional thriller in which nothing short of the fate of our nation is at stake.

episodes.name: Pilot
episodes.summary: In the opener of this "Manchurian Candidate"-like political thriller, a marine rescued after eight years as a POW in Afghanistan returns home a war hero. But a CIA operative suspects he may actually be an enemy agent with a connection to Al Qaeda and part of a plan to commit a terrorist act on U.S. soil.

episodes.name: Grace
episodes.summary: An undercover agent with connections to a Saudi prince who may be funding terrorist activities provides Carrie with a revealing bit of electronic evidence. Meanwhile, Carrie studies surveillance footage of life in Brody's home, where he appears troubled by traumatic memories and resists Pentagon and media pressure to be hyped as an American war hero.

episodes.name: Clean Skin
episodes.summary: An exclusive television interview will thrust the Brody family into the national spotlight, unless Dana pulls off her plan to sidetrack the whole bogus process. Elsewhere, Carrie and the team sniff out an Al Qaeda attack on American soil; and Carrie's embedded operative in Prince Farid's camp gets trapped in a chilling situation.

episodes.name: Semper I
episodes.summary: Political powers make big plans to promote Brody as a national hero, but erratic behavior on his part threatens his media image. Elsewhere, a desperate Carrie searches for evidence to link Brody with Abu Nazir, while Saul enjoins her to follow the terrorist financier's money trail.

episodes.name: Blind Spot
episodes.summary: Carrie believes her suspicions about Brody may be proven correct when he confronts the sole survivor of the insurgents who held him hostage. But the reunion ultimately raises more questions. Meanwhile, the agency zeros in on Aileen and Faisel, the lovers who used funds from the stolen jewelry to purchase the house near the airport.

episodes.name: The Good Soldier
episodes.summary: Having lost a number of essential personnel to Nazir's terrorist plot against the U.S., the CIA issue polygraph tests on everyone who had contact with them. This includes Brody, which Carrie hopes will reveal the truth about him.

episodes.name: The Weekend
episodes.summary: Carrie and Brody spend a weekend in the countryside, which ends up complicating their relationship further. Elsewhere, Jessica and Mike catch flak about the truth behind their relationship, while Saul catches Aileen hightailing it to Mexico.

episodes.name: Achilles Heel
episodes.summary: While Carrie and Saul are left reeling by the news that Walker is alive, the intelligence organisations squabble over how to capture him. The FBI leans toward using the public's help, but Carrie thinks they should use his family to draw him out. Elsewhere, Brody sets out to find a mysterious man who has surprising info about his years as a captive.

episodes.name: Crossfire
episodes.summary: Brody's efforts to sever ties with Abu Nazir triggers flashbacks to his time as a captive. Meanwhile, the mosque shooting results in a public-relations nightmare for Carrie.

episodes.name: Representative Brody
episodes.summary: Walker's Washington contact is identified by Carrie and Saul, but the target is protected via diplomatic immunity. Meanwhile, political bigwigs approach Brody about running for a disgraced congressman's seat.

episodes.name: The Vest
episodes.summary: When the dust settles from an explosion, Saul finds a manic Carrie hospitalised and realises there may be merit to her wild theories. Meanwhile, with his congressional campaign set to kick off, Brody takes the family on a weekend getaway to Gettysburg, where he obtains an important item.

episodes.name: Marine One
episodes.summary: In the Season 1 finale, a near-catatonic Carrie is confined to bed as Saul puzzles over the unnerving implications of her time line. Elsewhere, Walker settles on a perch from which to complete his mission; and Brody preps for the vice president's policy summit.

episodes.name: The Smile
episodes.summary: In the Season 2 premiere, Brody learns he is the political "future of the party," and receives a tantalizing offer from the vice president, while a recovering Carrie receives a disturbing request from a surprising source. In Beirut, Saul gets involved in some cloak-and-dagger doings.

episodes.name: Beirut is Back
episodes.summary: Carrie reluctantly returns to Beirut and an operation that might possibly spell the end of Abu Nazir; back in Washington, Brody is pressed into service by his handler, and his relationship with Jessica deteriorates. Meanwhile, Capt. Mike Faber has questions about the shooting of Elizabeth Gaines.

episodes.name: State of Independence
episodes.summary: The results of Carrie's Beirut mission lead her to believe that she'll be rejoining the CIA; and Brody discovers that the bomb maker is on a watch list and in imminent danger of being caught. Meanwhile, Jessica steps into the political spotlight.

episodes.name: New Car Smell
episodes.summary: Estes green-lights a covert mission based on intelligence gleaned from Beirut, and picks his own trusted operative to lead it; and Brody is shocked to bump into Carrie at Langley. Meanwhile, Dana and the vice president's son appear to have something in common.

episodes.name: Q&A
episodes.summary: Estes green-lights a covert mission based on intelligence gleaned from Beirut, and picks his own trusted operative to lead it; and Brody is shocked to bump into Carrie at Langley. Meanwhile, Dana and the vice president's son appear to have something in common.

episodes.name: A Gettysburg Address
episodes.summary: Dana's visit to the hospital proves shocking; Faber's interest in Tom Walker piques the CIA's interest; Brody agrees to team with Carrie and Quinn to prevent an attack on the U.S., but his loyalty is called to the fore when Gettysburg once again becomes a focal point of a pivotal engagement.

episodes.name: The Clearing
episodes.summary: In the aftermath of the ambush, Carrie and the team scramble to gain control of the operation, while Brody attends a well-heeled fund-raiser at a Virginia horse farm. Elsewhere, Saul drops in on Aileen, who is in solitary confinement, hoping she can shed some light on the latest attack; and a conflicted Dana leans on Finn to fess up to their crime.

episodes.name: I'll Fly Away
episodes.summary: Brody's juggling of alliances appear to be leading him to a major meltdown, so Carrie, against Quinn's orders, stages a dicey intervention. Meanwhile, a conflicted Dana seeks comfort from an unlikely source.

episodes.name: Two Hats
episodes.summary: Things for Brody are threatening to spiral out of control, forcing him to make a phone call he has been avoiding; Carrie preps for a pivotal meeting; Saul teams with Virgil and Max for an assignment.

episodes.name: Broken Hearts
episodes.summary: Brody and Walden develop a chink in their political relationship, and it may impact their future, while Dana and Finn come to an understanding concerning their differences. Meanwhile, Carrie discovers she's not as looped in as she thought.

episodes.name: In Memoriam
episodes.summary: Carrie's hunt for Nazir continues, but she suspects something's amiss inside the Agency, while interrogation reveals Roya's true colours. Meanwhile, unexpected circumstances put Saul's career in jeopardy

episodes.name: The Choice
episodes.summary: In the Series 2 finale, Carrie is faced with a pivotal decision, while Brody meets with Faber to contemplate the future of the family. Meanwhile, Saul undertakes a secret assignment; and Quinn has a decision to make that may prove to be a game-changer.

episodes.name: Tin Man is Down
episodes.summary: Season 3 begins with Brody remaining at large, while Carrie is called to testify before a senate committee investigating the terrorist bombing in Washington, D.C. Meanwhile, Saul takes command at the CIA; and the Brody family deal with a tragic occurrence.

episodes.name: Uh... Oh... Ah...
episodes.summary: Saul attempts to track down those responsible for the Langley attack and recruits an unlikely expert to follow the money trail. Meanwhile, Quinn takes matters into his own hands; Carrie learns who is really on her side; and the Brody family turn to therapy to mend their broken household.

episodes.name: Tower of David
episodes.summary: Brody returns to his faith for guidance in an unexpected way when he finds himself facing increasingly desperate straits. Back in the U.S., Carrie struggles to connect with Saul when a mysterious man offers to help her but at a significant cost.

episodes.name: Game On
episodes.summary: Carrie meets a new client over breakfast and learns that the crippled CIA can still exercise power when needed. Meanwhile, Dana runs away and Jessica seeks the police's help in finding her; and Saul follows the money trail to an unexpected location.

episodes.name: The Yoga Play
episodes.summary: A mysterious man enters the country at the U.S.-Canadian border; Carrie puts her mission on the line to do a risky favor; Saul is forced to socialize with his adversary, Sen. Lockhart, on an elite hunting trip; Dana makes a shocking discovery that could end her getaway for good.

episodes.name: Still Positive
episodes.summary: Carrie turns the tables on the mastermind of the Langley bombing and recruits one of Iran's most powerful operatives. Meanwhile, Saul struggles to keep an intrusive Sen. Lockhart at bay; and Dana makes a radical decision that changes her family forever.

episodes.name: Gerontion
episodes.summary: With his old adversary in custody, Saul makes the gamble of his career. Meanwhile, Carrie and Quinn scramble to contain a local police investigation; and Mira comes to a crossroad in her marriage.

episodes.name: A Red Wheelbarrow
episodes.summary: Carrie and Quinn pursue a key suspect in the Langley bombing; Saul faces political backlash; Fara discovers the high toll that an intelligence job can take; the Brody family receive startling news.

episodes.name: One Last Thing
episodes.summary: Carrie reunites with Brody, but the circumstances are more difficult than either of them imagined. Meanwhile, Saul gets a win from an unlikely source; and Dana struggles with her new life away from home.

episodes.name: Good Night
episodes.summary: Brody embarks on a high-stakes mission, but his fragile condition threatens the operation. Meanwhile, Quinn makes an uncomfortable discovery about Carrie; and Fara is forced to rejoin the team due to a sudden crisis.

episodes.name: Big Man in Tehran
episodes.summary: Brody's loyalty to the mission wavers when he meets a ghost from his past. Meanwhile, Lockhart's confirmation looms; and Saul stares into the precipice between success and failure.

episodes.name: The Star
episodes.summary: Season 3 ends with security forces closing in on Carrie and Brody, and Brody struggling to find redemption. Meanwhile, Saul plans a last-ditch rescue mission.

episodes.name: The Drone Queen
episodes.summary: Carrie makes a vital choice when her counterpart in Islamabad gives her urgent intelligence resulting in a media disaster. Saul has issues with his new position/job.

episodes.name: Trylon and Perisphere
episodes.summary: An inquiry brings Carrie back to the US where she has issues debating between her motherhood duties and her commitment to solving the drone strike issue. Quinn becomes more mentally unstable and an old case worker reveals new information.

episodes.name: Shalwar Kameez
episodes.summary: Carrie attempts to recruit an asset and leaves the US again. Quinn has further issues and communicates with the lady he previous protected and the CIA question his resignation.

episodes.name: Iron in the Fire
episodes.summary: Carrie gets a tip from Redmond regarding Quinn's lead. Saul calls in a favor with an old friend in the Pakistani military. Fara uncovers a deep-rooted conspiracy.

episodes.name: About a Boy
episodes.summary: Carrie tries to earn the trust of a frightened asset. On his way out of town, Saul catches a break when he spots a familiar face. Quinn and Fara stake out a new suspect.

episodes.name: From A to B and Back Again
episodes.summary: Carrie puts her operation in motion.

episodes.name: Redux
episodes.summary: Lockhart arrives in Islamabad to help negotiate Saul's release. Meanwhile, Carrie's investigation gets complicated as she deals with Saul's situation, the search for a hospital employee with the key to Haqqani's true medical condition and a serious threat to her own sharp focus.

episodes.name: Halfway to a Donut
episodes.summary: Carrie organizes a last-ditch operation. Lockhart and Martha stall the ISI.

episodes.name: There's Something Else Going On
episodes.summary: Carrie improvises to salvage her mission; the CIA closes in on a leak

episodes.name: 13 Hours in Islamabad
episodes.summary: The security breach at the Embassy has far reaching consequences.

episodes.name: Krieg Nicht Lieb
episodes.summary: Carrie puts her life on the line to get her team out of Pakistan.

episodes.name: Long Time Coming
episodes.summary: Series 4 ends with Carrie and Saul returning to the U.S. and investigating what she saw in Islamabad.

episodes.name: Separation Anxiety
episodes.summary: While Carrie tries to build a new life in Berlin, a request from her boss forces her back into the world she abandoned.

episodes.name: The Tradition of Hospitality
episodes.summary: Carrie and Düring visit a refugee camp. Saul and Allison are at odds.

episodes.name: Super Powers
episodes.summary: Jonas and Carrie revisit her past. Quinn stalks his prey.

episodes.name: Why is This Night Different?
episodes.summary: Answers elude Carrie; Laura asks Jonas for help; Saul and Allison run an operation.

episodes.name: Better Call Saul
episodes.summary: The hacktivists rise up; Quinn covers for Carrie; Dar and Allison assess the damage.

episodes.name: Parabiosis
episodes.summary: Saul orders a sweep at the station. Carrie looks to Düring for support.

episodes.name: Oriole
episodes.summary: Carrie reconnects with old friends; Saul opens up to Allison.

episodes.name: All About Allison
episodes.summary: Carrie needs Allison's help. Quinn's plans change.

episodes.name: The Litvinov Ruse
episodes.summary: The CIA and BND make a play.

episodes.name: New Normal
episodes.summary: A new threat emerges.

episodes.name: Our Man in Damascus
episodes.summary: Carrie follows a lead.

episodes.name: A False Glimmer
episodes.summary: The clock runs out.

episodes.name: Fair Game
episodes.summary: Carrie and Franny live in Brooklyn where Carrie works as an advocate for Muslim Americans. Dar and Saul brief President-elect Keane. Quinn struggles with his new circumstances.

episodes.name: The Man in the Basement
episodes.summary: Carrie and Reda fight for their client while Quinn fights against his new life. Saul and Dar suspect Keane has a secret.

episodes.name: The Covenant
episodes.summary: Saul goes to Abu Dhabi. Carrie delivers bad news. Quinn senses something.

episodes.name: A Flash of Light
episodes.summary: Carrie handles her client. Saul's trip takes a turn. Quinn investigates.

episodes.name: Casus Belli
episodes.summary: Keane gets sidelined. Carrie's work follows her home.

episodes.name: The Return
episodes.summary: Carrie follows a lead. Saul meets an old friend. Keane takes a stand.

episodes.name: Imminent Risk
episodes.summary: Carrie gets bad news. Saul makes a plan. Quinn accepts his situation.

episodes.name: Alt.Truth
episodes.summary: Carrie and Saul present evidence to Keane. Quinn tracks a mark.

episodes.name: Sock Puppets
episodes.summary: Carrie catches a break. Keane makes a plan. Max goes undercover.

episodes.name: The Flag House
episodes.summary: Dar plays his hand. Quinn revisits his past.

episodes.name: R is for Romeo
episodes.summary: Carrie and Quinn make a discovery. Keane makes a decision. Max finds trouble.

episodes.name: America First
episodes.summary: Pieces fall into place. Season finale.

episodes.name: Enemy of the State
episodes.summary: Carrie and Franny are living with Maggie's family in DC. Saul and the federal employees detained after the attempt on the President-elect's life are in prison. President Keane's administration comes under scrutiny.

episodes.name: Rebel Rebel
episodes.summary: Carrie makes a discovery. Wellington protects Keane. O'Keefe continues to broadcast.

episodes.name: Standoff
episodes.summary: Carrie has a distressing realization. Saul negotiates. Keane and Wellington disagree.

episodes.name: Like Bad at Things
episodes.summary: Carrie follows a lead. Saul's situation goes from bad to worse.

episodes.name: Active Measures
episodes.summary: Carrie puts a plan in motion. Saul visits a source. Keane makes a desperate plea.

episodes.name: Species Jump
episodes.summary: Saul calls an old friend. Wellington has a problem. Carrie enjoys a win.

episodes.name: Andante
episodes.summary: Carrie makes a move. Wellington has a reckoning. Saul expands an operation.

episodes.name: Lies, Amplifiers, F**king Twitter
episodes.summary: Carrie and Saul interrogate a suspect. Wellington makes a play.

episodes.name: Useful Idiot
episodes.summary: Carrie has problems at home. Saul and Wellington work on Paley.

episodes.name: Clarity
episodes.summary: Carrie needs to choose a side. Keane needs an ally. Saul has an idea.

episodes.name: All In
episodes.summary: Saul's mission is a go. The clock ticks on the Keane administration.

episodes.name: Paean to the People
episodes.summary: Carrie and Saul's mission doesn't go as planned. Elizabeth Keane fights for her presidency.

movies.name: The Walking Dead
movies.summary:
The Walking Dead tells the story of the months and years that follow after a zombie apocalypse. It follows a group of survivors, led by former police officer Rick Grimes, who travel in search of a safe and secure home. As the world overrun by the dead takes its toll on the survivors, their interpersonal conflicts present a greater danger to their continuing survival than the walkers that roam the country. Over time, the characters are changed by the constant exposure to death and some grow willing to do anything to survive.

Based on the comic book series of the same name by Robert Kirkman, Tony Moore, and Charlie Adlard.

episodes.name: Days Gone Bye
episodes.summary: Rick searches for his family after emerging from a coma into a world terrorized by the walking dead. Morgan and Duane, whom he meets along the way, help teach Rick the new rules for survival.

episodes.name: Guts
episodes.summary: Rick unknowingly causes a group of survivors to be trapped by walkers. The group dynamic devolves from accusations to violence, as Rick must confront an enemy far more dangerous than the undead.

episodes.name: Tell It to the Frogs
episodes.summary: Rick makes a decision to go back to Atlanta to retrieve the bag of guns and save a man's life. Lori and Shane must deal with the surprising return of someone they thought was dead.

episodes.name: Vatos
episodes.summary: Rick's mission to Atlanta is jeopardized when things go awry. Jim becomes unhinged in camp.

episodes.name: Wildfire
episodes.summary: Rick leads the group to the CDC after the attack. Jim must make a terrible life and death decision

episodes.name: TS-19
episodes.summary: Rick and the group are allowed into the CDC by a strange doctor. But all is not what it seems in their newfound haven.

episodes.name: What Lies Ahead
episodes.summary: After the CDC explosion, the survivors are still on the move when they encounter a herd of walkers that separates one of their own, leading them to a possible safe haven.

episodes.name: Bloodletting
episodes.summary: Coming to the aid of another, Rick discovers a possible safe haven. Shane must go on a dangerous mission to get badly needed medical supplies.

episodes.name: Save the Last One
episodes.summary: The group desperately awaits Shane's return. Shane finds himself trapped in a school, surrounded by the undead. Daryl and Andrea search for someone in the woods.

episodes.name: Cherokee Rose
episodes.summary: Shane makes a deadly sacrifice which leads to unusual behavior and self-distancing. The rest of the group tries to hang on somewhere between living to die and dying to live.

episodes.name: Chupacabra
episodes.summary: Glenn, the only one breaking barriers between both groups, knows far too much for his comfort level. Daryl finds a sign of life and, in his delirium, tries to make it back to the farm alive.

episodes.name: Secrets
episodes.summary: Secrets are told and secrets are revealed. Hershel refuses to acknowledge the world’s new reality. Andrea comes out of her shell. Everyone is becoming more and more aware that “everything is food for something.”

episodes.name: Pretty Much Dead Already
episodes.summary: Hershel sets a deadline. All secrets are out in the open. Glenn stands up for himself and Shane takes charge.

episodes.name: Nebraska
episodes.summary: Rick and the others try to restore order in the aftermath of a terrible discovery. Hershel takes up an old habit and disappears, Rick and Glenn must follow him into town.

episodes.name: Triggerfinger
episodes.summary: Trapped, Rick, Hershel and Glenn fight to survive against new foes, both dead and alive. Shane finds Lori in danger on the road and makes it his mission to bring her back to the farm.

episodes.name: 18 Miles Out
episodes.summary: Rick and Shane come into conflict over the fate of an outsider. Andrea helps Hershel's youngest daughter face a crucial decision.

episodes.name: Judge, Jury, Executioner
episodes.summary: Rick sides with Shane on an important decision, causing Dale to worry that the group is losing its humanity. Carl's actions have unintended consequences on the group.

episodes.name: Better Angels
episodes.summary: The group learns that someone dangerous may be on the loose near the farm. As night falls, Rick, Shane, Daryl and Glenn comb the woods to handle the situation and keep the group safe.

episodes.name: Beside the Dying Fire
episodes.summary: Rick and Carl return from the woods to find the farm in jeopardy. The group is split up in the ensuing chaos. With things looking grim, Rick’s leadership is questioned.

episodes.name: Seed
episodes.summary: With the world growing increasingly more dangerous and Lori’s pregnancy advancing, Rick discovers a potentially safe haven. But first he must secure the premises, pushing his group to its limit.

episodes.name: Sick
episodes.summary: After a traumatic event, a life hangs in the balance. Complicating matters, the group must also deal with a potential threat to their new surroundings.

episodes.name: Walk with Me
episodes.summary: After witnessing an accident, Andrea and Michonne are introduced to a new community of survivors. As conflicts arise with their new acquaintances, a decision must be made.

episodes.name: Killer Within
episodes.summary: The group is severed and lives are put in jeopardy. In Woodbury, Merle has a request for the Governor.

episodes.name: Say the Word
episodes.summary: After another loss, Rick struggles. Michonne remains suspicious of the Governor as he throws a party with a unique twist for the people of Woodbury.

episodes.name: Hounded
episodes.summary: As Andrea grows closer to the Governor, Michonne makes a decision about Woodbury. Glenn and Maggie go on a run. Rick struggles.

episodes.name: When the Dead Come Knocking
episodes.summary: The Governor presses for information. A new guest arrives at the prison, forcing Rick's hand.

episodes.name: Made to Suffer
episodes.summary: Andrea steps up as the people of Woodbury are thrown into uncharted territory. At the prison, a new threat arises.

episodes.name: The Suicide King
episodes.summary: Rick tries to rescue a member of his group. Woodbury is in disarray after a recent attack. New guests raise concerns at the prison.

episodes.name: Home
episodes.summary: As the group debates their next course of action, Rick wanders after a lost friend. Daryl and Merle question their choices. The Governor restores order in Woodbury and makes plans to punish those responsible.

episodes.name: I Ain't a Judas
episodes.summary: Their security threatened, Rick and the group must make a choice. With Woodbury in a police state, Andrea grows uneasy.

episodes.name: Clear
episodes.summary: Realizing they are heavily outgunned against the Governor's forces, Rick leads an expedition to get more weapons.

episodes.name: Arrow on the Doorpost
episodes.summary: In an effort to prevent any more deaths, Rick and the Governor meet to come up with a peace treaty.

episodes.name: Prey
episodes.summary: The Governor chases a dissenter who fled Woodbury. While the Governor is gone, a traitor tries to sabotage his upcoming plans.

episodes.name: This Sorrowful Life
episodes.summary: Rick and the group are faced with a serious problem. If they want a truce with the Governor, they will have to make a huge sacrifice.

episodes.name: Welcome to the Tombs
episodes.summary: Rick and the group have to seriously consider if the prison is worth defending as the Governor's impending attack looms over their heads.

episodes.name: 30 Days Without an Accident
episodes.summary: Rick and the group are as close to an ideal life as possible at the prison. Will they be able to hold on to humanity in the face of a new evil?

episodes.name: Infected
episodes.summary: As the group faces a brand new enemy, Rick and the others must fight to protect the livelihood they worked so hard to create at the prison.

episodes.name: Isolation
episodes.summary: As one group leaves the prison in search for supplies at a local college, those who stay must deal with recent losses while preserving what remains.

episodes.name: Indifference
episodes.summary: While on a supplies mission to a local college, members of the group run into multiple hurdles. Things at the prison are getting worse.

episodes.name: Internment
episodes.summary: Multiple enemies put pressure on Rick and the group. Could this finally be the breaking point for the survivors and the prison?

episodes.name: Live Bait
episodes.summary: A familiar face returns as each member of the group struggles to find his or her humanity in a world of constant threats.

episodes.name: Dead Weight
episodes.summary: A new and scary chapter is unfolding at a camp outside the prison. Will peace be attainable with the addition of new members?

episodes.name: Too Far Gone
episodes.summary: Just when everything started to calm down at the prison, Rick and his group now face imminent danger and destruction. This time, they might not win.

episodes.name: After
episodes.summary: As Rick deals with old wounds, members of the prison have to come to terms with their new environment and ask themselves if survival alone is enough.

episodes.name: Inmates
episodes.summary: The group encounters many obstacles in their quest to find stability and safety, but sometimes all they have to guide them is hope.

episodes.name: Claimed
episodes.summary: The group encounters many obstacles in their quest to find stability and safety, but sometimes all they have to guide them is hope.

episodes.name: Still
episodes.summary: Faced with the day-to-day survival of life outside shelter, a simple request by someone in the group leads to a bizarre but enlightening mission.

episodes.name: Alone
episodes.summary: As one group finds what may be an ideal shelter, another group comes to realize that the best protection comes from those around them.

episodes.name: The Grove
episodes.summary: After finding an idyllic place to establish a new shelter, the group starts to question whether it is possible to go back to the way things were.

episodes.name: Us
episodes.summary: However brutal some survivors believe they must be to stay alive, we get to see that faith can sometimes be the strongest survival tool.

episodes.name: A
episodes.summary: As multiple paths collide, Rick comes face to face with sheer brutality. Will he and the group have what it takes to survive?

episodes.name: No Sanctuary
episodes.summary: The true motives of the Terminans come to light when Rick and the others end up in a vulnerable situation.

episodes.name: Strangers
episodes.summary: With supplies running low and not knowing whether to trust the people around them, Rick leads a mission where the risk might not be worth the reward.

episodes.name: Four Walls and a Roof
episodes.summary: Rick and the group find themselves pitted against some very nasty people, but they might just have a plan to gain the upper hand.

episodes.name: Slabtown
episodes.summary: In this episode, we get to meet a whole group of other survivors, but what looks safe and nice on the outside has a bit of a dark side.

episodes.name: Self Help
episodes.summary: A new set of issues confront our group while on a mission. Will they be able to push through and survive these challenges? Or better yet, each other?

episodes.name: Consumed
episodes.summary: Cautiously, members of our group must venture into a familiar location on a heroic rescue mission. It's a huge stage, but so are the stakes.

episodes.name: Crossed
episodes.summary: Between holding down the church and going on a rescue mission, our group is spread pretty thin. Is this going to be the breaking point?

episodes.name: Coda
episodes.summary: Rick seeks a peaceful agreement when rules and morals are tossed aside by new enemies.

episodes.name: What Happened and What's Going On
episodes.summary: After the recent trials the group has faced, a slight detour could be the solution they've been searching for.

episodes.name: Them
episodes.summary: Life on the road has left the group beaten and beleaguered. Will they be able to trudge along? Are they even the same people they once were?

episodes.name: The Distance
episodes.summary: After a spectacular storm, Rick and the group meet a seemingly friendly person.

episodes.name: Remember
episodes.summary: Molding into a new lifestyle is proving difficult for the group. Has life on the road proven too treacherous to go back to who they once were?

episodes.name: Forget
episodes.summary: Rick and the group continue to acclimate to their new surroundings. Will they be able to go back to normalcy? Better yet, what is normal now?

episodes.name: Spend
episodes.summary: While trying to secure their new home, Rick and his group face many challenges, some life threatening. Is this really the utopia it seems to be?

episodes.name: Try
episodes.summary: The group realizes that sheltered life might not be possible as life within the walls starts to mimic life outside. Will these setbacks break Rick?

episodes.name: Conquer
episodes.summary: Daryl experiences trouble on a run while Rick and his group continue to feel like outsiders in Alexandria, where trouble is creeping into the gates.

episodes.name: First Time Again
episodes.summary: Rick and the others have a difficult time assimilating into Alexandria; a new threat arises that could bring the group closer together.

episodes.name: JSS
episodes.summary: When it appears that things are starting to normalize in the settlement, a new problem arises for the Alexandrians.

episodes.name: Thank You
episodes.summary: Rick and his group get caught up in a dangerous little town on the road back to Alexandria. Meanwhile, Daryl, Sasha and Abraham continue to lead away the remaining walkers away from the safe-zone.

episodes.name: Here's Not Here
episodes.summary: A new face appears; trust issues form.

episodes.name: Now
episodes.summary: Following a number of setbacks, the mood in Alexandria grows grim for the sheltered citizens.

episodes.name: Always Accountable
episodes.summary: Daryl, Abraham and Sasha encounter many obstacles and a new threat while trying to return to Alexandria.

episodes.name: Heads Up
episodes.summary: Alexandria is finally able to begin pulling itself back together; peace is embraced between the two groups.

episodes.name: Start to Finish
episodes.summary: After having a few moments of peace, trouble finds its way to Alexandria yet again. Only this time, the threat might be too big to defeat.

episodes.name: No Way Out
episodes.summary: With walkers inside the gates of Alexandria, Rick and the group are scared, outnumbered and things are only getting worse.

episodes.name: The Next World
episodes.summary: A simple scavenging run proves to be more tricky, when the survivors are not the only ones after a goldmine of supplies.

episodes.name: Knots Untie
episodes.summary: After Rick comes to the realization that Alexandria might not be as safe as he thought, decisions must be made about where to go from here.

episodes.name: Not Tomorrow Yet
episodes.summary: Rick and the group realize the only way to maintain the peace of Alexandria is to fight a new enemy. This time, though, our group might be outmatched.

episodes.name: The Same Boat
episodes.summary: With no hope of safety in Alexandria, Rick and his band of survivors soon discover a larger world with new dangers and new opportunities.

episodes.name: Twice as Far
episodes.summary: Two separate groups leave Alexandria for supplies, and while both worry over the future of the community, they will face immediate danger.

episodes.name: East
episodes.summary: When someone goes missing in Alexandria, the community goes on alert, and search parties venture out.

episodes.name: Last Day on Earth
episodes.summary: In the aftermath of a tragic blow, Eugene falls captured by Dwight, a member of the Saviors, whom are hell bent on getting even with Alexandria, Negan teaches Rick and co a brutal lesson, which shows that Rick and co finally have something to fear.

episodes.name: The Day Will Come When You Won't Be
episodes.summary: Last season ended with Rick and our group kneeling helplessly before Negan and his group; what Negan does will haunt those who survive forever.

episodes.name: The Well
episodes.summary: For a number of familiar faces, a new, well-established community seems too good to be true.

episodes.name: The Cell
episodes.summary: A new group of survivors seem to have it all in their impressive community; however, there is a price.

episodes.name: Service
episodes.summary: The remaining members of the group try to keep it together in Alexandria; they receive a sobering visit.

episodes.name: Go Getters
episodes.summary: Saddled with grief and surrounded by enemies, members of the group try to find safety at the Hilltop before it's too late.

episodes.name: Swear
episodes.summary: Someone stumbles upon a brand new society, and this society is unlike anything seen before.

episodes.name: Sing Me a Song
episodes.summary: A deeper look at the Sanctuary and the world of the Saviors; members of Alexandria look for supplies.

episodes.name: Hearts Still Beating
episodes.summary: Negan's unwelcome visit to Alexandria continues as other members scavenge for supplies; things quickly spin out of control.

episodes.name: Rock in the Road
episodes.summary: Rick is introduced to a new community.

episodes.name: New Best Friends
episodes.summary: While searching for a missing Alexandrian, Rick and his group encounter a mysterious collective, its inhabitants unlike any they have come across.

episodes.name: Hostiles and Calamities
episodes.summary: An Alexandrian discovers they must navigate the mysterious, confusing and terrifying world within the Saviors' compound.

episodes.name: Say Yes
episodes.summary: The group scavenges for supplies; back in Alexandria, someone must make a morally challenging decision.

episodes.name: Bury Me Here
episodes.summary: Things do not go as planned when a group of Kingdommers delivers goods to the Saviors during a routine supply drop-off.

episodes.name: The Other Side
episodes.summary: The Saviors visit the Hilltop unexpectedly, surprising everyone, with plans of taking more than supplies.

episodes.name: Something They Need
episodes.summary: A group of Alexandrians embarks on a journey; one member of the group must make a heartbreaking decision.

episodes.name: The First Day of the Rest of Your Life
episodes.summary: The stakes continue to grow higher as paths cross; the group enacts an intricate plan.

episodes.name: Mercy
episodes.summary: Rick and his group, along with the Kingdom and Hilltop, have banded together to bring the fight to Negan and the Saviors.

episodes.name: The Damned
episodes.summary: The plan involving Alexandrians, Kingdommers and Hilltoppers unfolds; as Rick continues to fight, he encounters a familiar face.

episodes.name: Monsters
episodes.summary: Conflict with the Saviors leads to unintended consequences for the Hilltop, the Kingdom, and Alexandria; morality proves tricky in wartime.

episodes.name: Some Guy
episodes.summary: A new weapon in the Savior arsenal proves to be a giant hurdle as fighting continues between Rick's forces and those of the Saviors.

episodes.name: The Big Scary U
episodes.summary: A close look at Negan and the lives of the Saviors during the conflict through a familiar set of eyes.

episodes.name: The King, the Widow, and Rick
episodes.summary: With things looking up for Rick and the group, an argument breaks out at the Hilltop; the consequences of the decision are life versus death.

episodes.name: Time for After
episodes.summary: Negan has to enlist the help of his lieutenants in solving a huge issue facing the Sanctuary; Rick and the group continue to enact the plan.

episodes.name: How It's Gotta Be
episodes.summary: Every story and battle from the first half of the season comes crashing together in this action-packed, emotional mid-season finale.

episodes.name: Honor
episodes.summary: Rick faces new difficulties after a battle. Meanwhile, the fight continues in other communities as core members face hard decisions.

episodes.name: The Lost and the Plunderers
episodes.summary: Groups unite their forces and converge on the Hilltop; Aaron and Enid search for allies.

episodes.name: Dead or Alive Or
episodes.summary: Daryl finds himself in bad company as his group heads to the Hilltop; Gabriel's faith gets tested.

episodes.name: The Key
episodes.summary: Hilltop's leadership faces a difficult dilemma after the arrival of unexpected visitors; Rick comes face to face with an adversary.

episodes.name: Do Not Send Us Astray
episodes.summary: Trouble arises when unexpected visitors arrive at the Hilltop and the community is thrust into action; heartbreaking discoveries are made.

episodes.name: Still Gotta Mean Something
episodes.summary: A Heaps prisoner makes a discovery; Carol searches for someone in the nearby forest; Rick and Morgan find themselves in the company of strangers.

episodes.name: Worth
episodes.summary: With the threat of the Saviors still looming, Aaron continues searching for allies; Daryl and Rosita take action and confront an old friend.

episodes.name: Wrath
episodes.summary: The communities join forces in the last stand against the Saviors as all-out war unfolds.

episodes.name: A New Beginning
episodes.summary: Rick and his group make a risky run into Washington, D.C. to search for artifacts they will need to build the civilization he and Carl envisioned.

episodes.name: The Bridge
episodes.summary: The communities join forces to restore a bridge that will facilitate communication and trade; someone is gravely injured at the construction site.

episodes.name: Warning Signs
episodes.summary: Rick's vision for the future is threatened by a mysterious disappearance that divides the work camp where the communities are building a bridge.

episodes.name: The Obliged
episodes.summary: Rick's vision of a civilized future is threatened by a sudden reckoning with past sins that remain unavenged and unforgiven.

episodes.name: What Comes After
episodes.summary: Rick is forced to face the past as he struggles to maintain the safety of the communities and protect the future he and Carl envisioned.

episodes.name: Who Are You Now?
episodes.summary: The Survivors encounter unfamiliar faces outside the safety of their community's walls and must decide whether or not this new group can be trusted.

episodes.name: Stradivarius
episodes.summary: Carol seeks out an old friend living alone in a wilderness teeming with walkers; survivors make the perilous trek to a new home.

episodes.name: Evolution
episodes.summary: A small rescue mission braves a dangerous herd in their hunt for a missing comrade, only to discover a surprising threat that could doom them all.

movies.name: The Big Bang Theory
movies.summary: The Big Bang Theory is a comedy about brilliant physicists, Leonard and Sheldon, who are the kind of "beautiful minds" that understand how the universe works. But none of that genius helps them interact with people, especially women. All this begins to change when a free-spirited beauty named Penny moves in next door. Sheldon, Leonard's roommate, is quite content spending his nights playing Klingon Boggle with their socially dysfunctional friends, fellow Cal Tech scientists Wolowitz and Koothrappali. However, Leonard sees in Penny a whole new universe of possibilities... including love.

episodes.name: Pilot
episodes.summary: Is a comedy about brilliant physicists, Leonard and Sheldon, who are the kind of "beautiful minds" that understand how the universe works. But none of that genius helps them interact with people, especially women. All this begins to change when a free-spirited beauty named Penny moves in next door. Sheldon, Leonard's roommate, is quite content spending his nights playing Klingon Boggle with their socially dysfunctional friends, fellow Cal Tech scientists Wolowitz and Koothrappali. However, Leonard sees in Penny a whole new universe of possibilities... including love.

episodes.name: The Big Bran Hypothesis
episodes.summary: Leonard volunteers to sign for a package, hoping to make a good impression on Penny. When he enlists the help of his obsessive-compulsive roommate, Sheldon, his attempt at chivalry goes horribly awry.

episodes.name: The Fuzzy Boots Corollary
episodes.summary: Leonard is bummed to learn that his crush, Penny, is seeing someone, so encouraged by his friends and fellow scientists, Leonard actually summons the nerve to ask a woman out on a date.

episodes.name: The Luminous Fish Effect
episodes.summary: When Sheldon gets fired, he explores life beyond physics, but his initial thrill of shopping with Penny devolves over time to him weaving ponchos as a shut-in, forcing Leonard to call on Sheldon's mother.

episodes.name: The Hamburger Postulate
episodes.summary: After sensing his pursuit of Penny isn't going anywhere, Leonard agrees to an unexpected sexual encounter with fellow scientist Leslie Winkle.

episodes.name: The Middle-Earth Paradigm
